arm_group.description: Summer months = June, July, August Winter months = December, January, February

brief_summary.textblock:
The objective of this study is to explore the relationship between moderate to severe
      hyponatremia and heat.

clinical_study.brief_title: Relationship Between Heat Wave and Hyponatremia

detailed_description.textblock:
We will explore the relationship between heat wave and moderate and severe hyponatremia in a
      population of adult patients admitted in the emergency department of a primary and tertiary
      care teaching urban hospital.  We will compare the prevalence of hyponatremia between summer
      and winter periods.  We will describe the types of observed hyponatremia and describe the
      characteristics of the patients suffering of moderate to severe hyponatremia.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  all adults (> 16 y) with blood natremia measured

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients without measure of natremia in the emergency department

study_pop.textblock:
Adults admitted to the emergency departement of a primary and tertiary care teaching
        hospital

intervention.description: The impact of high temperature during summer months on the prevalence of hyponatremia will be explores.

clinical_study.official_title: Relationship Between Heat Wave and Moderate to Severe Hyponatremia in the Emergency Departement of Primary and Tertiary Care Teaching Hospital.

primary_outcome.description: Moderate to severe hyponatremia is defined as Sodium blood levels < 125 mmol/L
primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with moderate to severe hyponatremia
primary_outcome.time_frame: Natremia measured at admission in the ED

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.
